Package plotly.fastCharts

Class PlotlyPie

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • plotly.fastCharts.PlotlyPie
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SerializableCompatibility
    public class PlotlyPie
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
    Invoke this class to build a fast pie chart.
    Call PlotlyPie(Composite parent, int style, double[][] datas) to obtain this composite.

    Exemple:
    double[][] values = { { 20.5, 40.5, 39 }, { 33, 33, 34 } };
    PlotlyPie pp = new PlotlyPie(HomeComposite, SWT.NONE, values);
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benoit Boucounaud
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getSelectedDatas

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getSelectedDatas()
        Return the selected data.
        Returns:
        Map<String, List<String>> - Map of selected data.

        Keys :
        • "curveNumber" : index in data of the trace associated with the selected points
        • "pointNumber" : index of the selected points
        • "x" : x values
        • "y" : y values

      • upColors

        public void upColors​(java.lang.String[][] colors)
        To update pie's colors.
        When you change color, all marker's values are delete, only new color stay.
        Parameters:
        colors - String[][] - Arrays of traces colors (ex : [ ["rgb(56, 75, 126)", "rgb(18, 36, 37)", "rgb(34, 53, 101)", "rgb(36, 55, 57)", "rgb(6, 4, 4)"], ["rgb(146, 123, 21)", "rgb(177, 180, 34)", "rgb(206, 206, 40)", "rgb(175, 51, 21)", "rgb(35, 36, 21)"] ] )

      • upHoverInfo

        public void upHoverInfo​(java.lang.String[] infos)
        To add/update hover infos. [trace1 hoverinfo, trace2 hoverinfo, ...].
        https://plot.ly/javascript/reference/#pie-hoverinfo

        Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors.
        Parameters:
        infos - String[] - Arrays of plot name (ex : ["label+percent", "percent"]

      • upHole

        public void upHole​(double[] holes)
        To add/update donuting.
        Number between or equal to 0 and 1.
        Sets the fraction of the radius to cut out of the pie. Use this to make a donut chart.
        Parameters:
        hole - double[] - (ex : [0.2, 0.5, ...])

      • upDomains

        public void upDomains​(int[][] domains)
        To update pie's domain. [ [row, column] ]
        Parameters:
        domains - int[][] - Arrays of traces domains (ex : [ [0,0], [0,1] ] )

      • upOptions

        public void upOptions​(int option,
                      boolean bool)
        To update plot's options.
        Parameters:
        option - int - Option to change :
        • 1 : showLink
        • 2 : scrollZoom
        • 3 : staticPlot
        • 4 : displayModeBar
        • 5 : displaylogo
        bool - boolean - Option's value.
